title: Viña Cobos 2013 Bramare Touza Vineyard Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Woody berry and cassis aromas are inviting and strong. This feels high in acidity and maybe more racy than you'd expect for Luján. Dry, spicy red-fruit flavors flow on a stream of potent acidity, while this finishes tangy, herbal and spicy, with a zesty note of pie cherry. Drink through 2022.

title: Torbreck 2012 The Pict Mataro (Barossa Valley)
description: Imagine a dark, smoky espresso bar, lined with leather banquettes. Mouthwatering scents of grilled meat waft in from a back garden. This is a full-bodied, plush rendering of Mourvèdre that doesn't show much freshness or fruit yet still caresses the palate.

title: Vinkara 2011 Reserve Boğazkere (Ankara)
description: Inky garnet to the eye, this wine offers aromas of cherry, black currant and orange peel. Flavors of blackberry, cassis, white chocolate, bell pepper and violet come alive on the palate amid mouth-coating tannins and nice savory notes. The finish is characterized by a lingering touch of orange zest.

title: King Estate 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This comes on tight and tart, with substantial flavors of apple, pear and peach. The depth and juicy acids suggest you'll want to put this on the dinner table alongside grilled halibut or swordfish, lightly spiced with lemon pepper and a splash of olive oil.

title: Fields Family 2014 Lodi Native Stampede Vineyard Zinfandel (Clements Hills)
description: An aroma like cherry wood and big, ripe fruit flavors shape this full-bodied and very bold-tasting wine. It's dry in style, has some good, fine-grained tannins for grip, and flavors that recall dried raspberries and cherries. It has the concentration to age, so best to drink after 2018.

title: Giovanni Manzone 2012 Castelletto  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of iris, violet, menthol and fresh berry come together on this. The bright palate offers raspberry, cherry, chopped mint, toast and licorice alongside assertive tannins that give the finish grip.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha Red (Tejo)
description: With six months of oak aging, this wine has both richness and spicy concentration. It is densely structured and solid with tannins. The black fruits are spreading through the wine, giving another element of richness. Dark and dense, the wine needs to age further. Drink from 2018.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha

title: Zaca Mesa 2012 Mesa Reserve Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Not as deeply purple as other Syrahs, this bottling shows more broad red-fruit aromas of caramelized cherry along with lilacs, violets, crushed black rocks and vanilla cola. Mulberry, dark strawberry and plum elements bring intrigue to the palate, which also offers savory black sesame and hoisin notes.

title: Wild Ridge 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the producer's Annapolis vineyard, planted at 700 to 900 feet, this is a floral, spicy and high-toned wine. It shows pomegranate, plum and a noticeable streak of forest among its highlights, the tannins integrated and kept fresh and structured by the acidity.

title: Willi Haag 2015 Brauneberger Juffer Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Delicate notes of white grapefruit and crushed minerals on the nose of this sprightly spätlese intensify on the palate, amassing layers of sweet peach, tangerine and caramel flavors. It's an richly concentrated wine calibrated by zesty acidity and a delicately astringent finish.

title: Carlo Giacosa 2013 Montefico  (Barbaresco)
description: A beautiful fragrance of rose, iris, pressed powder, perfumed berry and baking spice wafts out of the glass. The approachable, luminous palate offers bright red cherry, fresh raspberry, cinnamon and a sprinkling of white pepper alongside soft, supple tannins.

title: Chambers Rosewood Vineyards NV Muscat (Rutherglen)
description: This seems slightly fresher than the basic Muscadelle, offering more balanced flavors, including a touch of orange zest. It's sweet and long, with notes of brown sugar and citrus lingering on the long, more-ish finish.

title: Château de Santenay 2014 En Vesvau  (Saint-Aubin)
description: The appellation is increasingly noted for its rich and generous white wines, like this bottling. This wood-aged wine is ripe with apples and peaches and fragrant with a squeeze of lime juice. It is balanced, full of acidity and rich fruit finished with a light toast. Drink from 2018.

title: Adelsheim 2014 Breaking Ground Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: As you'd expect from this pioneering Oregon winery, this is a smooth, sophisticated, accessible yet ageable wine. Polished berry and cherry fruit is swathed in cola and cocoa highlights, running through silky tannins. Drink now through 2020.

title: Aubichon Cellars 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This is packaged in a hock bottle, as if to emphasize the bone dry minerality of this all-stainless cuvée. Aromatic and crisply dry, it was aged on the lees for five months, and deftly mixes nuanced flavors of citrus, wet stone, fresh herbs and light greens.

title: Blackett 2013 Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a brand, created in the 19th century that had almost disappeared until rescued in the last decade. This Vintage comes from 40 to 60-year-old vines in the Douro Superior, giving a wine with soft tannins and great fruit concentration. It is floral from the Touriga Nacional with fine acidity to balance the ripe, sweet fruit. Drink from 2025.

title: Bret Brothers 2014 Climat Les Clos Reyssié  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This ripe wine comes from vines from two parcels: one normally in the wine, with vines more than more than 60-years-old, the other a hilltop vineyard added in 2014. It is full of rich white fruits that skirt on the zesty side of citrus, giving a crisp edge to this otherwise full wine. It is balanced, juicy and ready to drink.

title: Brick House 2013 Cascadia Chardonnay (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Here is a reserve-level wine that is a showcase for elegance rather than sheer power. Refined flavors of peach, pear and melon carry notes of cilantro and a finishing lick of Butter Brickle. Give this a little extra breathing time, or cellar till 2018.

title: Cortes de Cima 2014 Pinot Noir (Alentejano)
description: There is a definite juicy red-fruit Pinot Noir character in this warm wine. It has spice, fine acidity and layers of red-berry fruits. The light tannic structure holds this fine wine properly together. Drink now.

title: Deaver 2012 Ten Zin Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Intensity and subtle power are the hallmarks of this full-bodied, very ripe and fruit-saturated wine. While waves of blackberry jam and sweet black cherry coat the tongue, a sense of sweetness and viscosity clings to the sides of the mouth.

title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2015 Bernkasteler Badstube Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Delicate notes of waxy lemon peel and apple waft from this light-footed spätlese. Its honeyed sweetness penetrates to the core, accenting flavors of pressed apple and pear. The finish is zesty and spry, leaving only a hint of black-tea tannins.

title: Duckhorn 2012 Monitor Ledge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From a warm site on the valley floor, this wine is soft and velvety, approachable and sophisticated. An additional 8% Merlot and 4% Petit Verdot provide complexity and further softness, the wine buoyant in juicy blueberry, currant and fig.

title: Domaine Philippe Goulley 2010 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)
description: Now mature, this ripe wine has a creamy texture that is cut with the steely acidity of Chablis. Yellow fruits and a bright aftertaste keep this wine in the fruity stage. The aftertaste, though, has a more leafy character that shows its maturity. Drink now.

title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2013 Clos du Dessus des Marconnets  (Beaune)
description: As its name suggests, this vineyard is above the Marconnets, one of Beaune's top vineyards. Beautifully perfumed, it is ripe with orange zest, apples and a streak of delicious citrus acidity. It has a light touch, fruity, with hints of wood and minerality.

title: MacLaren 2013 Drouthy Neebors Syrah (Sonoma County)
description: This is a blend of the three of the producer's single-vineyards, 42% from Atoosa, 29% Samantha and 29% Moaveni. The whole is greater than its parts in its complementary marriage of floral violet and lavender with black pepper and meat, the texture soft and plush.

title: Jerusalem Wineries 2013 4990 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Judean Hills)
description: Deep red-violet in the glass, this wine has a nose of black cherry, smoked meat and a hint of green pepper. It is a well-balanced wine with sturdy tannins and flavors of black cherry, blackberry, anisette, violet and ground black pepper. The finish is characterized by a touch of orange peel and a sense of salinity.

title: Fiuza 2014 Premium Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)
description: This powerful, ripe wine is a delicious testament to the structured qualities of the Alicante Bouschet. It is rich and dense, with juicy blackberry flavors and dark tannins. With the wood aging smoothing out the wrinkles, the wine is impressive. Drink from 2017.

title: Philippe Colin 2014 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)
description: Although the domaine is mainly centered on Chassagne-Montrachet, neighboring Saint-Aubin is hardly far. This ripe, yellow and citrus-fruit-flavored wine is already delicious. Touches of toast from wood aging along with balanced acidity give it both crispness and richness. Drink now.

title: Presqu'ile 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This is a stunner because it shows such minerally depth, which many strive for but few achieve on a pink wine. The classic shade of pink gives way to bubblegum, lime juice, orange rind and smashed raspberry aromas. The zesty, vibrant lime juice acidity cuts right through plum fruit, but it's the graphite and chalky tension that wins the palate.

title: Prinz Salm 2013 Kabinett Riesling (Nahe)
description: Smoke and dusty mineral notes juxtapose ripe, sweet peach and apricot flavors in this fruity but complex wine. It's as savory as it is sweet, accented by spicy notes of saffron and bee pollen. The finish is long, pristine and refreshing.
